result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jorge E Pesqueira

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jorge E Pesqueira in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Jorge E Pesqueira.  Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purpose of sentencing.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Jorge E Pesqueira not in court, in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant's appearance is waived. Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 30. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Jorge E Pesqueira not in court, in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Br 30.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision level 5.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jorge E Pesqueira in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Jorge E Pesqueira in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jorge E Pesqueira appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
